result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny R Hunley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Complaints [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs, surcharges, victim witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by DOC. To be paid during period of Extended supervision under case 13CF5802.  If not paid, civil judgment.

****AMENDED ORDER, dated October 1, 2014, Judge Mel Flanagan, sentence to reflect 9 months (not 90 days) sentence. ***IT IS ORDERED/ dated October 1, 2014/Judge Mel Flanagan/that the JOC in case 13CF5802 shall be amended to state that counts 1 & 2 are concurrent with each other and concurrent with cases12CF5183 & 14CF817.  IT IS ORDERED THAT CASE 14CF817 shall be amended to reflect a 9 month sentence. JOC 13CF5802 & concurrent cases shall reflect 137 days time served credit.***

04-23-15, Judge Flanagan;  Order Amending Judgments Of Conviction - ordered  that the 90 days of jail time as a condition of extended supervision in Case# 13CF005802 is vacated.  Further, ordered that references to Case# 12CF005182 in judgments of conviction shall be corrected to refer to Case# 12CF005183 - signed by the Court and filed
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction  of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnny R Hunley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order Amending Judgments Of Conviction - ordered  that the 90 days of jail time as a condition of extended supervision in Case# 13CF005802 is vacated.  Further, ordered that references to Case# 12CF005182 in judgments of conviction shall be corrected to refer to Case# 12CF005183 - signed by the Court and filed.  Copies mailed to parties.
Clerk:  jms
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mel Flanagan, Br. 4, for review. mag
DOC request to review judgments of conviction, received in 13CF005802 and 14CF000817.

AMENDING Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.
- IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the judgment of conviction in case (2014CF817) shall be amended to reflect a nine-month (not a 90 day) sentence.
-
- IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the judgment of conviction in case 2013CF5802 shall be amended to state that counts one and two are concurrent with each other and concurrent with cases 2012CF5182 and 2014CF817.  The judgment shall reflect a total of 137 days of sentence credit on counts one and two.   mld
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mel Flanagan, Br. 4, for review. jbs
Letter from DOC seeking clarification of sentence structure and amendment to judgment of conviction, received in cases 13CF005802 and 14CF000817.  Filed in 13CF005802.
Original Transcript (6 pages) commencing on 06-23-2014 SENTENCING received and filed.

Defendant Johnny R Hunley in court with attorney Joshua D Uller.  Defendant Johnny R Hunley in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

 AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1: defendant sentenced to serve 90 DAYS (CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  

Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of extended supervision under case 2013CF5802), or if not paid, a CIVIL JUDGMENT. 

48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

  Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.   mld

AS TO THE AMENDED CHARGE:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 4.

Defendant Johnny R Hunley in court with attorney Joshua D Uller.  Defendant Johnny R Hunley in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Pursuant to plea  negotiations and on motion of the  State, Court ordered the charge amended to INTIMIDATION OF A VICTIM contrary to Wis. Stats. Sec. 940.44(2), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joshua D Uller in court, defendant Johnny R Hunley not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Cases 2013CF5802 and 2014CF817 called simultaneously with co-defendant case; 2014CF818.  Upon the motion of the State, the Court ordered the following cases CONSOLIDATED for the purposes of trial: 2013CF5802, 2014CF817 and 2014CF818.  Court would allow defense counsel to raise the issue of consolidation of the cases, if they can bring forth new evidence.  

The State will be providing all remaining discovery to defense counsel.  Case 2013CF5802 adjourned for Evidentiary Hearing / Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-30-2014 at 8:30 am.  The State will supboena their witnesses for the hearing on 5-30-2014, per ADA Heitman.  Cases 2014CF817 and 2014CF818 adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-30-2014 at 8:30 am.   All (3) three cases 2013CF5802, 2014CF817 and 2014CF818 adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 8-11-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney Joshua D. Uller in court (via telephonics).  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Status Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 4-22-2014 at 8:30 am, along with co-defendant case; 2014CF818 (Cecilia Kirk).   mld

Defendant Johnny R Hunley in court with attorney Joshua D. Uller.  Defendant Johnny R Hunley in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee County DA Investigator James Thomas.  Court took judicial notice of the victim named in the prior complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss heard and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of the discovery from the State.  Offer will be forthcoming to defense counsel, per the State.  Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 4 on 3-12-2014 at 8:30 am.   Court defers on State's Motion for the Consolidation of cases 2013CF5802 and 2014CF817.   mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DEMETRIA S. OR CO-DEF:  CECILIA KIRK.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Johnny R Hunley in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Defendant Johnny R Hunley in custody.  Francesco G Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
